item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 24, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. I designed a Dieter Rams-inspired iPhone dock (1169 points | 265 comments)

3. In 1870, Lord Rayleigh used oil and water to calculate the size of molecules (267 points | 95 comments)
4. Show HN: I Wrote a Book on Java (361 points | 92 comments)

7. Inside a Ferroelectric RAM Chip (88 points | 36 comments)
8. What, Me Worry? The Art and Humor of Mad Magazine (164 points | 73 comments)
9. Perfect prevention vs. perfect detection (13 points | discuss)
10. Free-form floor plan design using differentiable Voronoi diagram (164 points | 30 comments)
11. Compress JPG: The Image Compressor That Lets You Compress Images Securely (6 points | discuss)
12. Launch HN: Panora (YC S24) – Data Integration API for LLMs (58 points | 10 comments)
13. Dumped orange peel transformed a barren pasture (2017) (47 points | 13 comments)
14. Cache Me Not, Cache Me, Cache Me Not (32 points | 9 comments)

20. Developing a Go bot embedding Ichiban Prolog (50 points | 5 comments)
21. Why is F# code so robust and reliable? (32 points | 15 comments)
22. Nintendo Kawaii Progress (Keychain-Sized Nintendo Wii) (18 points | 5 comments)
23. Overview of cross-architecture portability problems (84 points | 15 comments)
24. Show HN: A journaling service that runs over WhatsApp (73 points | 53 comments)
25. What I've Learned in the Past Year Spent Building an AI Video Editor (14 points | 1 comment)
26. Averaging is a convenient fiction of neuroscience (67 points | 54 comments)
27. Cloudflare's new marketplace lets websites charge AI bots for scraping (375 points | 244 comments)
28. A Web-based WYSIWYG editor for automation routines (12 points | 2 comments)
29. NeRF-Supervised Feature Point Detection and Description (41 points | 1 comment)
30. Dot (YC S21) Is Hiring an Engineer to Automate Analytics (Remote) ( | hide)
